    • Method Detail

      • TYPE_FK

        public static String TYPE_FK(String fk_field,
                             String reference_table,
                             String reference_field)
        Generates a foreign key declaration for creating tables. It makes the values ​​of one column pointing a value of the column from another table, for example: DBHelper.TYPE_FK( Controllers_detail.DBSchema.COLUMN_1,Controllers.DBSchema.TABLE_NAME, Controllers.DBSchema.KEY_UNIQUE_1) will generate a part of query that tells SQLite to create a foreign key on Controllers_detail.DBSchema#COLUMN_1 that will be referring to Controllers.DBSchema#KEY_UNIQUE_1 in another table, pointed by its name - Controllers.DBSchema#TABLE_NAME and it will look like follows: FOREIGN KEY(ControllerID) REFERENCES Controllers(ControllersID)
        Parameters:
        fk_field - Column's name that should be a foreign key in table which calls this method.
        reference_table - Table that will b pointed by a fk_field
        reference_field - Column of the reference_table that will be pointed by a fk_field
        Returns:
        Partial queries for SQLite responsible for creating foreign keys.

        public void openConnection()

      • sql_generate_not_exitsting_minID

        public static int sql_generate_not_exitsting_minID(Class<? extends DBHelper.TableIF> tableClass)
                                            throws InstantiationException,
                                                   IllegalAccessException
        Finds minimum ID that not exist in chosen table. The method performs a query that selects IDs from table tableName and returns the minimum, not existing, value.
        Parameters:
        tableClass - One of table names from DBHelper.SQL_TABLE_NAME.
        Returns:
        Minimal ID for the selected tableName that not exists yet (eg for INSERT queries)
        Throws:
        IllegalAccessException - Thrown when a program attempts to access a tableClass which is not accessible from the location where the reference is made.
        InstantiationException - Thrown when a program attempts to access a tableClass' constructor which is not accessible from the location where the reference is made.

      • sql_select_by_id

        public Cursor sql_select_by_id(Class<? extends DBHelper.TableIF> tableClass)
                        throws InstantiationException,
                               IllegalAccessException
        Select query to database that returns every row. Usage example: DBHelper dbHelper = new DBHelper(getApplicationContext()); dbHelper.openConnection(); Cursor cur; try { cur = dbHelper.sql_select_by_id(General.class); Log.d("DB", DatabaseUtils.dumpCursorToString(cur)); } catch (Exception e) { e.printStackTrace(); } In order to view returned data you can use DatabaseUtils.dumpCursorToString(Cursor) method.
        Parameters:
        tableClass - The table in the database that is represented by a class that implements DBHelper.TableIF.
        Returns:
        Cursor to returned set of data by execution of previously generated select query in this method.
        Throws:
        IllegalAccessException - Thrown when a program attempts to access a tableClass which is not accessible from the location where the reference is made.
        InstantiationException - Thrown when a program attempts to access a tableClass' constructor which is not accessible from the location where the reference is made.

      • sql_select_by_id

        public Cursor sql_select_by_id(Class<? extends DBHelper.TableIF> tableClass,
                               int KEY_UNIQUE)
                        throws InstantiationException,
                               IllegalAccessException
        Select query to database that returns one row which matches to KEY_UNIQUE. Usage example: DBHelper dbHelper = new DBHelper(getApplicationContext()); dbHelper.openConnection(); Cursor cur; try { cur = dbHelper.sql_select_by_id(General.class,1); Log.d("DB", DatabaseUtils.dumpCursorToString(cur)); } catch (Exception e) { e.printStackTrace(); } In order to view returned data you can use DatabaseUtils.dumpCursorToString(Cursor) method.
        Parameters:
        tableClass - The table in the database that is represented by a class that implements DBHelper.TableIF.
        KEY_UNIQUE - ID value that uniquely represents one row in tableClass table.
        Returns:
        Cursor to returned set of data by execution of previously generated select query in this method.
        Throws:
        IllegalAccessException - Thrown when a program attempts to access a tableClass which is not accessible from the location where the reference is made.
        InstantiationException - Thrown when a program attempts to access a tableClass' constructor which is not accessible from the location where the reference is made.

      • sql_select_by_id

        public Cursor sql_select_by_id(Class<? extends DBHelper.TableIF> tableClass,
                               Set<String> columnNames,
                               int KEY_UNIQUE)
                        throws InstantiationException,
                               IllegalAccessException
        Select query to database that returns selected columns in one row which matches to KEY_UNIQUE. Usage example: DBHelper dbHelper = new DBHelper(getApplicationContext()); dbHelper.openConnection(); try { Set<String> columns = new HashSet<String>(); columns.add(General.DBSchema.COLUMN_1); Cursor cur = dbHelper.sql_select_by_id(General.class,columns,1); } In order to view returned data you can use DatabaseUtils.dumpCursorToString(Cursor) method.
        Parameters:
        tableClass - The table in the database that is represented by a class that implements DBHelper.TableIF.
        columnNames - Column names that should be selected in database query.
        KEY_UNIQUE - ID value that uniquely represents one row in tableClass table.
        Returns:
        Cursor to returned set of data by execution of previously generated select query in this method.
        Throws:
        IllegalAccessException - Thrown when a program attempts to access a tableClass which is not accessible from the location where the reference is made.
        InstantiationException - Thrown when a program attempts to access a tableClass' constructor which is not accessible from the location where the reference is made.

      • sql_select_by_id

        public Cursor sql_select_by_id(Class<? extends DBHelper.TableIF> tableClass,
                               Set<Integer> KEY_UNIQUEs)
                        throws InstantiationException,
                               IllegalAccessException
        Select query to database that returns rows which matches to one of KEY_UNIQUEs. Usage example: DBHelper dbHelper = new DBHelper(getApplicationContext()); dbHelper.openConnection(); try { Set<Integer> keys = new HashSet<Integer>(); keys.add(1); Cursor cur = dbHelper.sql_select_by_id(General.class,keys); } In order to view returned data you can use DatabaseUtils.dumpCursorToString(Cursor) method.
        Parameters:
        tableClass - The table in the database that is represented by a class that implements DBHelper.TableIF.
        KEY_UNIQUEs - ID values that uniquely represents rows in tableClass table.
        Returns:
        Cursor to returned set of data by execution of previously generated select query in this method.
        Throws:
        IllegalAccessException - Thrown when a program attempts to access a tableClass which is not accessible from the location where the reference is made.
        InstantiationException - Thrown when a program attempts to access a tableClass' constructor which is not accessible from the location where the reference is made.

      • sql_select_by_id

        public Cursor sql_select_by_id(Class<? extends DBHelper.TableIF> tableClass,
                               Set<String> columnNames,
                               Set<Integer> KEY_UNIQUEs)
                        throws InstantiationException,
                               IllegalAccessException
        Select query to database that returns selected columns in rows which matches to one of KEY_UNIQUEs. Usage example: DBHelper dbHelper = new DBHelper(getApplicationContext()); dbHelper.openConnection(); try { Set<String> columns = new HashSet<String>(); columns.add(General.DBSchema.COLUMN_1); Set<Integer> keys = new HashSet<Integer>(); keys.add(1); Cursor cur = dbHelper.sql_select_by_id(General.class,columns,keys); } In order to view returned data you can use DatabaseUtils.dumpCursorToString(Cursor) method.
        Parameters:
        tableClass - The table in the database that is represented by a class that implements DBHelper.TableIF.
        columnNames - Column names that should be selected in database query.
        KEY_UNIQUEs - ID values that uniquely represents rows in tableClass table.
        Returns:
        Cursor to returned set of data by execution of previously generated select query in this method.
        Throws:
        IllegalAccessException - Thrown when a program attempts to access a tableClass which is not accessible from the location where the reference is made.
        InstantiationException - Thrown when a program attempts to access a tableClass' constructor which is not accessible from the location where the reference is made.

      • sql_insert_row

        public void sql_insert_row(Class<? extends DBHelper.TableIF> tableClass,
                           Map<String,String> newValues,
                           boolean isToClear)
                    throws InstantiationException,
                           IllegalAccessException
        Insert query to database. In this method the ID parameter that is used in sql_insert_row(Class, Map, boolean) is auto generated by sql_generate_not_exitsting_minID(Class) helper class. Usage example: DBHelper dbHelper = new DBHelper(getApplicationContext()); dbHelper.openConnection(); try { Set<String> columns = new HashSet<String>(); columns.add(General.DBSchema.COLUMN_1); Set<Integer> keys = new HashSet<Integer>(); keys.add(1); Cursor cur = dbHelper.sql_select_by_id(General.class,columns,keys); }
        Parameters:
        tableClass - The table in the database that is represented by a class that implements DBHelper.TableIF.
        newValues - Set of pairs in form: (<COLUMN_NAME>,<NEW_VALUE>) (Usage example).
        isToClear - Flag that can only take the values of CLEAR_YES or CLEAR_NO. It determinates whenever to call Map.clear() method in order to avoid creating new Map object for another execution of that method.
        Throws:
        IllegalAccessException - Thrown when a program attempts to access a tableClass which is not accessible from the location where the reference is made.
        InstantiationException - Thrown when a program attempts to access a tableClass' constructor which is not accessible from the location where the reference is made.

      • sql_insert_row

        public void sql_insert_row(Class<? extends DBHelper.TableIF> tableClass,
                           int KEY_UNIQUE,
                           Map<String,String> newValues,
                           boolean isToClear)
                    throws InstantiationException,
                           IllegalAccessException
        Insert query to database.
        Parameters:
        tableClass - The table in the database that is represented by a class that implements DBHelper.TableIF.
        KEY_UNIQUE - ID value that uniquely represents one row in tableClass table.
        newValues - Set of pairs in form: (<COLUMN_NAME>,<NEW_VALUE>) (Usage example).
        isToClear - Flag that can only take the values of CLEAR_YES or CLEAR_NO. It determinates whenever to call Map.clear() method in order to avoid creating new Map object for another execution of that method.
        Throws:
        IllegalAccessException - Thrown when a program attempts to access a tableClass which is not accessible from the location where the reference is made.
        InstantiationException - Thrown when a program attempts to access a tableClass' constructor which is not accessible from the location where the reference is made.
